meanings.sent1: I used hot water to solubilize the sugar in my tea.
meanings.sent2: She added detergent to solubilize the grease stains on her shirt.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to solubilize the playing cards into thin air, but they just fell to the ground.
meanings.sent4: His smile had the power to solubilize the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth seemed to solubilize the frost on the window, making it disappear.

meanings.definition: To dissolve (a substance) in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The chemist needed to solubilize the salt in water for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The sugar will solubilize quickly in the hot coffee.
meanings.sent3: The rain seemed to solubilize the chalk drawings on the sidewalk, creating colorful puddles.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to solubilize his doubts and fears.
meanings.sent5: The music had a magical quality that seemed to solubilize the worries of the listeners.
